title: BUG?: Cannot get data recursively form sibling
body:
#### What is the problem?
We work in sibling datasets. The siblings have new or edited data that need to be merged (including file content) into a master location. This does not seem to be possible. Can you please have a look. We are stuck with trying to merge some data one of the collaborators has processed.

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?
```
datalad create origindata
cd origindata/
datalad create -d subdataset
echo "You can see me" > subdataset/test.me
datalad save -r
cd ..
datalad install -r -s origindata newclone
cd newclone/
echo "see you again" > subdataset/file2.me
datalad save -r
cd ../origindata/
datalad siblings add --recursive --name newclone --url "/DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/newclone/"
datalad update --merge -r --sibling newclone
ll subdataset/
datalad get -r -s newclone .
```

<details><summary>Output</summary>

```console
[dorian@mri geterr]$ datalad create origindata
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/origindata
create(ok): /DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/origindata (dataset)
[dorian@mri geterr]$ cd origindata/
[dorian@mri origindata]$ datalad create -d subdataset
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/origindata/subdataset
create(ok): . (dataset)
[dorian@mri origindata]$ echo "You can see me" > subdataset/test.me
[dorian@mri origindata]$ datalad save -r
add(ok): subdataset (file)
add(ok): .gitmodules (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 2)
  save (ok: 1)
[dorian@mri origindata]$ cd ..
[dorian@mri geterr]$ datalad install -r -s origindata newclone
[INFO   ] Cloning origindata into '/DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/newclone'
install(ok): /DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/newclone (dataset)
[INFO   ] Installing <Dataset path=/DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/newclone> underneath /DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/newclone recursively
[INFO   ] Cloning /DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/origindata/subdataset into '/DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/newclone/subdataset'
action summary:
  get (ok: 1)
  install (ok: 1)
[dorian@mri geterr]$ cd newclone/
[dorian@mri newclone]$ echo "see you again" > subdataset/file2.me
[dorian@mri newclone]$ datalad save -r
add(ok): file2.me (file)
save(ok): subdataset (dataset)
add(ok): subdataset (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 2)
  save (ok: 2)
[dorian@mri newclone]$ cd ../origindata/
[dorian@mri origindata]$ datalad siblings add --recursive --name newclone --url "/DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/newclone/"
.: newclone(+) [/DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/newclone/ (git)]
subdataset: newclone(+) [/DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/newclone/subdataset (git)]
[dorian@mri origindata]$ datalad update --merge -r --sibling newclone
[INFO   ] Fetching updates for <Dataset path=/DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/origindata>
[INFO   ] Applying updates to <Dataset path=/DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/origindata>
update(ok): . (dataset)
[INFO   ] Fetching updates for <Dataset path=/DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/origindata/subdataset>
[INFO   ] Applying updates to <Dataset path=/DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/origindata/subdataset>
update(ok): subdataset (dataset)
action summary:
  save (notneeded: 1)
  update (ok: 2)
[dorian@mri origindata]$ ll subdataset/
total 8
lrwxrwxrwx 1 dorian dorian 116 Dec 19 19:59 file2.me -> .git/annex/objects/jf/gq/MD5E-s14--f46130674abdba284039f4c449374588.me/MD5E-s14--f46130674abdba284039f4c449374588.me
-rw-r----- 1 dorian dorian  15 Dec 19 19:54 test.me
[dorian@mri origindata]$ datalad get -r -s newclone .
[INFO   ] Installing <Dataset path=/DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/origindata> underneath /DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/origindata recursively
[WARNING] Running get resulted in stderr output: git-annex: get: 1 failed

[ERROR  ] from newclone... [get(/DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/origindata/subdataset/file2.me)]
get(error): subdataset/file2.me (file) [from newclone...]
[WARNING] could not get some content in /DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/origindata/subdataset ['/DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/origindata/subdataset/file2.me'] [get(/DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/origindata/subdataset)]
get(impossible): subdataset (directory) [could not get some content in /DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/origindata/subdataset ['/DATA/dorian/dataladtest/geterr/origindata/subdataset/file2.me']]
action summary:
  get (error: 1, impossible: 1, notneeded: 1)
```
</details>
#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?
0.12.0rc6

#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?
No
#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (to assess your expertise/prior luck.  We would welcome your testimonial additions to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/wiki/Testimonials as well)
NA
